meanings.sent1: The epigraphical study of ancient writings helps us understand history better.
meanings.sent2: The museum displayed an epigraphical stone with intricate carvings.
meanings.sent3: I find it amusing how epigraphical research can reveal hidden stories from the past.
meanings.sent4: Her memory was like an epigraphical tablet, etched with the events of her life.
meanings.sent5: The epigraphical details on the monument made it stand out among the ruins.

meanings.sent1: The epigraphical tablet bore the name of the ancient king.
meanings.sent2: The old coin was epigraphical, with words in a language no longer spoken.
meanings.sent3: It was amusing to find an epigraphical message hidden inside the old tree trunk.
meanings.sent4: Her heart felt epigraphical, marked with the love she had experienced.
meanings.sent5: The epigraphical ring held a secret message engraved on its surface.

meanings.definition: Pertaining to the study of ancient inscriptions.
meanings.sent1: The epigraphical research team uncovered a new set of hieroglyphics.
meanings.sent2: Scholars often use epigraphical evidence to decipher ancient languages.
meanings.sent3: It was amusing to see how excited the students were about epigraphical findings.
meanings.sent4: The epigraphical journey into the past revealed surprising connections.
meanings.sent5: The epigraphical expedition led to the discovery of a lost civilization.
